site_name: Car Park To Rear Of Craven House
description: Construction of six four-storey terraced dwellinghouses; provision of associated amenity space including roof terrace, cycle storage, refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): 001 P01 Site Location Plan; 005 P02 Existing Block Plan; 010 P01 Existing Plan; 040 P01 Existing Sections; 070 P01 Existing Elevations; 105 P04 Proposed Block Plan; 110 P04 Proposed Ground Floor Plan; 111 P04 Proposed First Floor Plan; 112 P04 Proposed Second Floor Plan; 113 P04 Proposed Third Floor Plan; 114 P04 Proposed Roof Plan; 140 P03 Proposed Section and Side Elevations; 170 P04 Proposed Front and Rear Elevations; 200 P01 Proposed Houses 1-4 Part M Compliance; 270 P01 Proposed Bay-Study Elevations; 600 P02 Proposed Street View 1; 601 P02 Proposed Street View 2; Design and Access Statement (MDLR Architects) dated 19.12.2024; Planning Statement (City Planning) dated 19.12.2024; Noise Impact Assessment (RBA Acoustics) dated 17.12.2024; Preliminary Risk Assessment (Risk Management) dated 12.2024; Energy Statement (Energy Lab) dated 12.2024; Daylight and Sunlight Report (EB7) dated 18.12.2024; Flood Risk Assessment (CGS Consulting Engineers) dated 12.2024; Arboricultural Planning Report (AD Trees Ltd) dated 16.18.2024; Transport Statement (City Planning) dated 12.2024
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application and the plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and policy D4 of the London Plan (2021). | All recommendations in the submitted Noise Impact Assessment (RBA Acoustics) dated 17.12.2024, shall be complied with in full and implemented with high-quality workmanship.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or vibration from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the installation of the new hard surfaces within the Root Protection Area (RPA) of the Caucasian Lime Tree (T1), Ealing Council's Tree Service Department must inspect the ground, including the tree's roots and soil. The applicant's arborist must also report on the process of removing the hard surface and installing the new hard surface. This report shall include how the new garden walls and structures will be built without harming the tree. The report shall be made available to the Tree Service Department prior to inspection.
Reason: To ensure that the development would comply with Policy G5, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Suitable precautions shall be undertaken to secure and protect all street trees within the vicinity of the site, and no trees shall be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.
Reason: To ensure that the development would comply with Policy G5, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Prior to the installation of the crossover, the final version of the design must be approved by the Highways Department and the Tree Service Department.
Reason: To ensure that the development would comply with Policy T2, T4, G5, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a Biodiversity Gain Plan (which shall include a programme for its implementation), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: It appears to the Council that the site contains more than 5 metres of onsite linear habitat. To ensure that the biodiversity gain objective is met, in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990) and Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021).
| Prior to first occupation, the amenity spaces, hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatments shall be installed and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), Policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and the London Plan (2021).
